title: Japan’s Small IPOs Fall to 12-Year Low Amid Market Reforms
description: The number of small-sized initial public offerings in Japan this year fell to its lowest in more than a decade, as the Tokyo Stock Exchange’s reform push prompted private companies to reconsider quick listings.
content: The number of small-sized initial public offerings in Japan this year fell to its lowest in more than a decade, as the Tokyo Stock Exchange’s reform push prompted private companies to reconsider quick listings.
